attributes.title: The Supreme Thought Current of Manifesting
attributes.description: 9 Jul 2016 morning satsang. “With seeking, spiritual practice starts; with right Guru’s initiation, spiritual practices end! After that, no matter what you do, it is manifesting…” expresses Paramahamsa Nithyananda in Nithya Satsang of 9th July 2016 at Varanasi on Kena Upanishad. Expounding on the sacred truths of the Shanti Mantra and the first verse of this Upanishad, His Holiness teaches us the ‘Supreme Thought Current’ or the supreme mental setup of MANIFESTING what we want in life. He insists on ‘sitting with tremendous declaration’ to MANIFEST. Only with the right Guru’s initiation, the seeds of extraordinary powers, extraordinary experiences are sown, and thus the disciple or seeker can MANIFEST. Spiritual practices, then, should be done only from the context of manifesting in our every step, in thinking, walking, talking., living. He also beautifully defines SEEKING as the coming to the basic questions of life. And whenever we face failure, the need to ask fundamental questions and reorganize, reinvent without the fear of dropping, burning some part of us – that courage is called RUDRA.
